author: Hrishva Rangani
text: Finance: The Language of Opportunities In a world where every decision seems to have a price tag, finance is the invisible hand guiding us. Whether youâ€™re a business leader analyzing investments or someone planning a vacation, understanding finance empowers you to make informed choices.But here's the truth:Â finance isnâ€™t just numbers, itâ€™s a story of value, risk, and potential. Itâ€™s the art of allocating resources, the science of forecasting, and sometimes, the thrill of calculated risks.Why it matters now more than ever:1) Global markets are evolving faster than ever, driven by tech innovations like blockchain and AI.2) Financial literacy is no longer optional itâ€™s essential for personal and professional growth.3) Investing isnâ€™t just for Wall Street; itâ€™s for anyone with a dream of building wealth sustainably.hashtag#Finance hashtag#Investing hashtag#FinancialLiteracy hashtag#WealthManagement

author: Romuald Wadagni
text: Un tournant historique pour le BÃ©nin ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡¯Â et le climat Ce 23 avril Ã  Washington, en marge des AssemblÃ©es de printemps du International Monetary Fund et de The World Bank, nous avons franchi une Ã©tape majeure avec la signature dâ€™un MÃ©morandum-Cadre inÃ©dit sur le financement climatique, en prÃ©sence de nos partenaires internationaux de premier plan.Ce cadre, signÃ© aux cÃ´tÃ©s de Marie-Chantal Uwanyiligira, Directrice de la Banque mondiale pour le BÃ©nin, la CÃ´te dâ€™Ivoire, la GuinÃ©e et le Togo, et de Olivier Buyoya, Directeur rÃ©gional de la SFI (IFC - International Finance Corporation) pour lâ€™Afrique de lâ€™Ouest, ainsi que des reprÃ©sentants de la BAD, de lâ€™AIIB, du Fonds OPEC et de lâ€™Union europÃ©enne, marque le dÃ©but dâ€™une collaboration renforcÃ©e et structurÃ©e en matiÃ¨re de politique climatique.Ce partenariat vise Ã  :â€¢â Â â renforcer nos institutions et capacitÃ©s techniques,â€¢â Â â mobiliser des financements innovants, publics et privÃ©s Ã  grande Ã©chelle,â€¢â Â â mettre en Å“uvre des projets Ã  fort impact, en ligne avec nos Contributions DÃ©terminÃ©es au niveau National (CDN) et les Objectifs de DÃ©veloppement Durable (ODD),â€¢â Â â promouvoir la transparence et la redevabilitÃ© dans la gestion des ressources climatiques.Je remercie chaleureusement nos partenaires pour leur confiance et leur engagement. Ensemble, nous traÃ§ons une voie ambitieuse pour un BÃ©nin plus vert, plus rÃ©silient et porteur dâ€™opportunitÃ©s pour les gÃ©nÃ©rations futures.hashtag#BÃ©nin hashtag#FinanceClimatique hashtag#DÃ©veloppementDurable hashtag#BanqueMondiale hashtag#IFC hashtag#ODDâ€”â€”A historic milestone for Benin ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡¯ and climate actionOn April 23rd in Washington, D.C., on the sidelines of the IMF and World Bank Spring Meetings, Benin took a bold step forward by signing a groundbreaking Climate Finance Framework Memorandum with key international development partners.This frameworkâ€”signed alongside Marie-Chantal Uwanyiligira, World Bank Country Director for Benin, CÃ´te dâ€™Ivoire, Guinea, and Togo, and Olivier Buyoya, IFC - International Finance Corporation Regional Director for West Africa, as well as representatives of the AfDB, AIIB, OPEC Fund, and the European Unionâ€”establishes a coordinated platform to align climate policies with macroeconomic planning and unlock large-scale financing.Together, we aim to: â€¢	strengthen institutional capacity to design and implement climate-resilient projects and policies, â€¢	mobilize public and private capital through innovative instruments, including green bonds and Article 6 mechanisms, â€¢	enhance transparency, accountability, and efficiency in climate finance management.I extend my sincere appreciation to our partners for their trust and continued support. With this shared vision, we are laying the foundation for a greener, more resilient, and inclusive Benin, where climate ambition drives sustainable economic transformation.hashtag#Benin hashtag#ClimateFinance hashtag#SustainableDevelopment hashtag#WorldBank hashtag#IFC hashtag#GreenEconomy hashtag#ResilientGrowth hashtag#GreenGrowth hashtag#SpringMeetings hashtag#WBGMeetings

author: Rahmat Diansyah
text: Halo, semuanya! Saya sedang mencari peran baru dan akan menghargai dukungan Anda. Jika Anda memiliki informasi tentang peluang silakan kirimi saya pesan atau berkomentar di bawah.Tentang saya dan yang saya cari:ğŸ’¼ Saya mencari pekerjaan dengan peran Operation Management, Head Operations Office, Operations Manager, Regional Operations Manager & Terbuka untuk peluang lainğŸŒ Saya terbuka untuk peran di Jabodetabek dan jika perlu relokasi ke tempat lain saya bersediaâ­ Saya sebelumnya bekerja di perusahaan multifinance / pembiayaan : PT BFI Finance Indonesia, Tbk & MNC LeasingDengan pengalaman lebih dari 10 tahun di industri multifinance, saya memiliki keahlian kuat di bidang Operation Management, khususnya dalam:âœ“ Pengelolaan operasional cabang (front & back office)âœ“ Monitoring dan evaluasi proses kerja harianâœ“ Peningkatan efisiensi layananâœ“ Pelaksanaan proyek improvementâœ“ Kepatuhan terhadap SOP dan regulasi industriâœ“ Supervisi tim & pencapaian target kinerjaâœ“ Audit operasional cabangâœ“ Kolaborasi lintas unit (bisnis, collection, dll) hingga level pusatSertifikasi & Penghargaan:âœ“ Best Operation Managerâœ“ Penerima Beasiswa Gubernurâœ“ Sertifikasi SPPI Managerâœ“ Sertifikasi Leadership DevelopmentBila Bapak/Ibu memiliki informasi terkait peluang kerja yang sesuai, saya sangat menghargai kesempatan untuk berdiskusi lebih lanjut.Terima kasih atas perhatiannya.Best regards,Rahmat DiansyahIzin Tag Bapak/Ibu Ang Harry T. Paradoxe ?3- Le monde n'est pas noir ou blanc. Il faut apprendre Ã  bosser ensemble,  et (re?) apprendre Ã  se parler. Mais ce qui est hashtag#japonais,  c'est le cÃ´tÃ© hashtag#sÃ©rieux. ğŸ‘‰Ã€ chaque voyage,  nous essayons d'Ãªtre un peu plus sÃ©rieux,  de regarder au delÃ  de ce qu'on voit ( on ne voit souvent que ce qu'on croit... comment chercher Ã  apprendre et non Ã  confirmer !). Ã€ chaque voyage, les patrons qui sont lÃ  et qui pensent tout le temps Ã  leur boÃ®te,  leurs employÃ©s,  leurs clients et Ã  continuer d'Ãªtre rentables pour durer, et Ãªtre utiles, ces patrons repartent avec de nouvelles dÃ©couvertes,  de nouvelles idÃ©es,  et rien que pour Ã§a,  Ã§a vaut la peine !ğŸ’¥Alors, on fait quoi ? Ou alors, on admet qu'il est possible,  sÃ©rieusement,  de voir les choses autrement ?Ã  Azincourt... les franÃ§ais Ã©taient plus forts,  plus nombreux... et se sont fait massacrer.  Pas envie !!!Michael BallÃ© Anne-Lise Seltzer Siham Bentalab BERENICE DUTHUILLE Christophe RICHARD Julie Chevalier Margaux Mercier Christophe Riboulet Cyril DanÃ© Jean-Baptiste Bouthillon Jean-Claude Bihr Thomas Walter BÃ©nÃ©dicte Mercier Romain Boscher Dimitri Baeli Julien Marjac Arnaud BARDE ğŸ‘‘ Kevin Raynel

author: Cyber-IT Magazine
text: âš ï¸Un faux site imitant les impÃ´ts piÃ¨ge les contribuables !âš ï¸En pleine pÃ©riode de dÃ©claration d'impÃ´ts, des cybercriminels ont mis en ligne une rÃ©plique Ã©tonnamment convaincante du site officiel des impÃ´ts franÃ§ais, "impots.gouv[.]fr". Ce site frauduleux, actif depuis le 17 avril et mis Ã  jour rÃ©cemment, vise Ã  dÃ©rober les identifiants de connexion et les numÃ©ros fiscaux des contribuables imprudents.ğŸ’¥ L'alerte a Ã©tÃ© donnÃ©e par Nicolas Martinez, PDG de la start-up LayerOps: Deploy on Multi-Cloud & Hybrid-Cloud Platforms, qui a partagÃ© une capture d'Ã©cran d'un e-mail frauduleux. Ce courriel, usurpant l'identitÃ© de la direction gÃ©nÃ©rale des finances, prÃ©texte une notification officielle et invite les destinataires Ã  cliquer sur un lien. ğ‚ğ ğ¥ğ¢ğğ§ ğ«ğğğ¢ğ«ğ¢ğ ğ ğ¯ğğ«ğ¬ ğ®ğ§ ğŸğšğ®ğ± ğ¬ğ¢ğ­ğ ğ¢ğ§ğ­ğğ«ğ§ğğ­ ğšÌ€ ğ¥'ğšğğ«ğğ¬ğ¬ğ "ğœğ¨ğ§ğ§ğğœğ­ğ¢ğ¨ğ§-ğ¬ğğœğ®ğ«ğ¢ğ¬ğ[-]ğŸğ«ğšğ§ğœğ[-]ğ ğ¨ğ®ğ¯[.]ğŸğ«".âŒ Ce site pirate est une copie conforme de l'interface officielle des impÃ´ts. Il incite les utilisateurs Ã  saisir leur identifiant (numÃ©ro fiscal) et leur mot de passe. Les cybercriminels ont mÃªme intÃ©grÃ© des mÃ©canismes pour rendre le site plus crÃ©dible : par exemple, un mot de passe composÃ© de dix chiffres identiques sera signalÃ© comme incorrect, renforÃ§ant l'illusion de lÃ©gitimitÃ©.Ce type d'escroquerie n'est malheureusement pas nouveau et refait surface chaque annÃ©e lors de la campagne de dÃ©claration fiscale. Le numÃ©ro fiscal, encore relativement confidentiel sur le marchÃ© noir, reprÃ©sente une donnÃ©e prÃ©cieuse pour les pirates souhaitant commettre des usurpations d'identitÃ©. En se faisant piÃ©ger, les victimes divulguent non seulement leur identifiant fiscal, mais aussi potentiellement leur mot de passe, une information souvent rÃ©utilisÃ©e sur d'autres plateformes en ligne.Les consÃ©quences peuvent Ãªtre graves : au-delÃ  du vol d'identitÃ©, les cybercriminels peuvent dÃ©poser de fausses dÃ©clarations fiscales au nom des victimes. En 2ï¸âƒ£ 0ï¸âƒ£ 1ï¸âƒ£ 9ï¸âƒ£ , prÃ¨s de 2 000 cas de piratages de comptes fiscaux avaient Ã©tÃ© recensÃ©s, avec des dÃ©clarations frauduleuses incluant des achats fictifs.La Direction gÃ©nÃ©rale des Finances publiques a annoncÃ© la mise en place d'un systÃ¨me d'identification Ã  double authentification sur son portail officiel, qui sera dÃ©ployÃ© Ã  partir de cet Ã©tÃ©. Cette mesure renforcera la sÃ©curitÃ© des comptes en ligne, mais en attendant, la vigilance de chaque citoyen reste la meilleure protection contre ces tentatives de fraude.Source : https://lnkd.in/e2JD-fTK par Bogdan Bodnarhashtag#Impots hashtag#CyberIT hashtag#Cyber hashtag#Pirates

author: Okoye Chinelo
text: In 2020, I made a $7,000 hire based on money that hadnâ€™t hit my account yet. The pipeline looked full. Clients had promised to pay. So I moved.I felt sure about the decision.The calls with clients ended in â€œyes.â€My email was full of â€œweâ€™ll pay soon.â€But then:- Two payments got delayed (ouch)- One client disappeared (no reply, nothing)- Payroll was up, cash was downI had to use my savings to pay my new hire.___________________________________________That month, I learned something big:- You donâ€™t forecast with hope.- You forecast with numbers, systems and a real business process behind every decision.- Until the money lands, itâ€™s not available for spending.And after working behind the scenes with fast-growing founders, Iâ€™ve seen this exact mistake play out again and again.In one word? Forecasting.In one mistake? Doing it without data.Hope is not a plan.A full pipeline is not cash in the bank.A promise is not a payment.Poor cash flow forecasting doesnâ€™t always look like missing money.___________________________________________Sometimes, it looks like:- Hiring before the invoice clears- Taking on one more client when you shouldnâ€™t- Launching a new offer while three retainers are already late- - - Now, I only make key decisions when the entire system is aligned. Not before.If youâ€™re running a business, or leading a lean team, cash flow forecasting should live inside your operations, not just your finances.It tells you what you can afford, and when.It guides hiring, launches, capacity, and client intake.___________________________________________Itâ€™s not just about money.Itâ€™s about making sure your business can grow without breaking.Which of the updates did it for you?Repost if you found it helpful___________________________________________PS: I will be speaking on work-life harmony , building a brand that pays you without burning you out at the serenity experience with the incredible Schnel (Chartered MCIPD) HansonI shared the attendance details in my comment section PSS: I share the juicy stuff in my comments

author: Russell Merry
text: Today is my final day as Managing Director of â€˜Wheelsâ€™ at Frasers Group. Short version: I helped a talented team turn around a business struggling with post pandemic bicycle industry issues and integration into a large organisation. Evans Cycles and â€˜wheelsâ€™ in Sports Direct are now trading well and have a solid platform for growth. Long version (for those with a coffee in hand): Itâ€™s been a journey (not least Poole to Junction 29 M1 most weeks) and I have learned a lot whilst helping to put the Frasers Wheels/Evans Cycles business on a solid platform for accelerated success. We set a strategy that was â€˜Three Pillars of Opportunityâ€™ which we followed and meant we have opened shops (Max Ellis MRICS), implemented web Dropship (Giedre Baliutaviciute) launched Ride2Work across Frasers Group, closed shops, won the Center Parcs bike contract, strengthened supplier relationships, acquired Pro-Bike Kit, Wiggle, Chain Reaction (James France) and their numerous product brands including a new Vitus range and we sold Nuke Proof.  We have launched an entire range of Pinnacle parts across Sports Direct with new Pinnacle bikes just launched and new John Williamsâ€™ new Vitus bikes soon to ship and much much more. It is for me, however, the image below (thank you Matthew A. - store opening supremo)  that encapsulates my time at Frasers Group.  My understanding is that this bike was a surprise birthday present for this little boy and he has received an excellent bike which was well designed by Tom Bugler while he was at Frasers. The bike is commercially viable with a good margin/profit because it was well sourced by the excellent Christina H. from a reliable and high quality factory - thanks Saheela Mehrotra.   The bike came from a new Evans Darlington store swiftly opened by the best retail management team in the industry David Crapper Michael Briggs with creative marketing provided by David Greenwood and if it ever goes wrong (it wonâ€™t) Dean Saunders will be there to help!  This Muddy Fox bike is excellent value for money too and so will help with the goal to get more people cycling more often whether sold in store or on one of the many web platforms managed by Colin Edwards!During my time as MD we bought in brands like Whyte, Rapha and Frog and bought back Fox and Cube whilst Darren Walker fixed the Evans finance offering so we could raise the ASP to new heights on the new bikes that our Senior Commercial Manager Patrick Wallace bought (whilst fixing all the basics) and Frasers Champion Maciej Natora shipped to store.The best thing about my time at Frasers Group was that we made it a team effort because the team knew I believed â€œit only works if it all works!â€ And the little boy got a great birthday present!!All of this was achieved with a guiding hand from Suzy Murphy Three years done! Thanks everyone.

author: Faizan Khan
text: Career update: After more than half a decade , I bid farewell to a one of a kind , very special work place , L'Oreal.One  really has to be here to experience what L'Oreal has to offer. They say 3 months here is equal to 3 years and beyond that is just a lifetime and That's exactly what it feels like today. I believe L'Oreal has stood the test of time for over a century and without a doubt it will continue thriving for many more centuries to come. Why?  Here's a list of a few priceless lessons I proudly leave with: *Keep it simple* : Do one thing, but do it reallyyy well! *Keep it incremental* : Approximately right , directionally correct is usually enough. Reality will have changed anyway by the time you execute. Keep moving forward.*Keep it crazy* : Dream big , deliver big , be disruptive : hashtag#createthebeautythatmovestheworld *Collaboration vs Process*. We proudly resist structure and tedious processes, we hate the words here! The Process is what you and I agree on what works for us at the time.*Customer centricity vs Hierarchy/Function* : it's BAU at L'Oreal when the country manager  pitches in on a retailer's new beauty floor design, HR  brainstorms with us on an eid plan and our commercial director will go and present it on ground, our finance teams help in closing a retailer contract. Thats when the magic happens- together in chaos.You can't lose with a culture like this. These ethos belong to L'Oreal and I've seen them come to life everyday for the last 5+ years, and what a pleasure it has been.Thank you Junaid Murtaza Sanaa Ahmed for introducing me to the amazing world of L'Oreal.Huge shout to a friend, partner, part time shrink and brother Faizan Rahman - I will miss you the most.All the amazing leaders, friends & team members - some who've transitioned some still standing tall, Thank You!Qawi Naseer Rehan Saeed Hunbal Bin Sohail Adeela Liaquat Ali Khan Hashim Mamsa Alina Shamsi Samay Ahmed Syed Obaid Syed Sultan Haider Soban Shahid Ummehani Hirani Babar Hashmi Batool Naqvi Ammar Lodhi Mutaal Shafqat Aaraiz Hashmi @hafiz salman Shahzaib Atique Muhammad Farhan Ali Khan Kamran Quraishi Khurram Chaudhry Omer Tiwana Imran Ahmed Khan Ali Arshad Goraya Muhammad Ahsan Shahzain Hafeez Ali Haider Lotia Waqar Asim Muhammad Talal Moin Tehzeeb UL Hassan Fatima AHmed Anum F. Hasnaini Esha Mullick Shoaib Durrani Shazer Baig Fahad Feroze Samaa Siraj Muhammad Umar Sajid To all my business partners and friends across retail, distribution and trade. . My wonderful distributor sales teams.Thank you for believing in me, and keep believing in L'Oreal!So much Love.

author: Akanksha Holani
text: I hope this is a false alarm, but I need to say it. India and Pak are heading to war.You need to prepare. It doesn't take much to put 2 and 2 together. But, let me still speak from my early experience as a political journalist.  The Indus water treaty has been suspended, we never saw that happen and that is no matter how bad things got. This isn't like all the times India and Pakistan locked horns and exchanged angry looks. This is actual action and it's happening onground. Both the countries have deployed more troops at the borders.Â High-importance CCS have been conducted on both ends. Foreign ambassadors briefed on both ends. Everyone is involved.Heck, even the likes of Akhilesh Yadav, Owaisi and Rahul Gandhi are for the first time in full support of the government in whatever course of action it deems fit. When was the last time you saw the entire opposition in agreement? And so, now would be the time to apply whatever I have learned as a finance writer to help you. I thought hard about posting this on a public platform. Don't want to worry people who are already reeling from distress and shock, but you need to brace for more shock.Tough, but it's coming!1. Stock up on essentials. Not to cause paranoia but at least 3 months of non-perishables, get them before the prices go sky. 2. Have liquid cash. At least worth 3 months' expenditure. 3. Don't even think about the stock market right now. That is the first to go! Energy and pharma stocks have already boomed, don't enter defence now, and sell-off isn't an option either. 4. Get health insurance. You should always have one, even during peace times, but now more NECESSARY! 5. Don't apply for any new loans. Repo Rates will be double digit if we do go to war. 6. Focus on safer assets, if you want to invest - more stable currencies, Gold, etc. Don't make any bold investment decisions at least for the next month.7. During war, economies tumble, even the winning side loses. Think twice before you put down your papers in the next two months.Â War doesn't allow the privilege to choose passions over survival.We may not have to wait for too long, the next two days are diplomatically and politically critical. I do hope that neither country has to escalate. War is never good for noone, even if you're on the winning side. It seems highly unavoidable this time. Don't be a sitting duck, prepare. And inform your friends. Talk about it with your parents. Plan and protect. That's all!And I might come across as a fearmonger, I would rather be that than a gatekeeper.hashtag#kashmirattack hashtag#war hashtag#prepare hashtag#India hashtag#JaiHind

author: Ives Tay
text: ğŸ¤‘ğŸ’¼ 15K a month in Singapore? That's cute. I just watched a street interview where someone casually dropped that they earn $15,000 to $20,000 a month in Singapore and said life here is "comfortable".Comfortable... for whom?Here's the thing:Singapore is one of the most unequal developed nations.The median salary here is around $5,000/month, not $15K.While some live in high-rise condos, others struggle with rising rents and stagnant wages.Itâ€™s easy to romanticize a country when you're living on a gold-plated expat package or in finance. But letâ€™s not mistake individual privilege for universal experience.The real flex? Not saying how much you earn - but asking how everyone else is doing.ğŸ’¬ I dare you: Whatâ€™s the real cost of â€œsuccessâ€ in cities like Singapore?

author: Martijn Bron
text: "Just ask" -Steve Jobs, is what I often think, and advise others, trusting that when you have a genuine request, people say yes. I admit I still thought against the odds, I asked Goldman Sachs' Co-Head of Global Commodities Research Daan Struyven to participate in the Strong Source commodity podcast. But he responded quickly and enthusiastically, and now we are happy to share the podcast with him with our audience of commodity enthusiasts. Daan studied business engineering, economics and political sciences at the University of Brussels, did an MBA at the Indian Institute of Management, and a PhD in Economics at MIT, spanning from 2004 to 2015. That is a very impressive curriculum. In 2015 Daan started working for Goldman Sachs as a US economist in New York. Goldman is a magical name in the world of finance, from banking to trading, and we asked him why he choose to work for Goldman, and how he managed to land a job there, an aspiration of many of the best and the brightest students.Â In the following years he moved through the ranks to become Senior Global Economist, co-leading Goldman's Global Economics team in 2022.Â In 2023 he moved from being a general economist to become a Senior Energy Economist and shortly after, Head of Oil Research, so entering the world of commodities. Since late last year, after less than a decade with Goldman, he became Goldmanâ€™s Co-Head of Global Commodities Research, a great achievement.We discuss Goldman's in-depth commodity research: the outlook and structural trends in oil, natural gas, gold, and copper, their view on tariffs, and the impact of geopolitical scenarios. The podcast was recorded before the current macro turbulence, but that does not matter for understanding and learning from Daan and Goldman's thought process and the price framework they apply in any environment.In this video clip Daan says something important which he learned from Goldman's former head of commodities research Jeff Currie, and what I explained regularly related to the cocoa market: the purpose of commodity prices is to impact behavior of producers and consumers, and we know changing behavior isn't easy....so you need sharp price moves to change behavior, ensuring supply and demand imbalances are corrected. That is why the rallies in natural gas prices during the 2022 energy crisis, and more recently cocoa and coffee prices were brutal, to the extent that the mainstream media, general public, and regulators noticed it. To balance supply and demand, these moves are supposed to be brutal and trying to regulate prices artificially only delays the inevitable, as no one is bigger than the market.  My co-host Alexander Sterk and I really enjoyed this podcast, which will be live later today, I am sure our audience will too.Thanks Daan!

author: CA Kathit Parikh
text: Have you imagined how Tabby, Tamara, or any other BNPL model works?Buy-Now-Pay-Later (BNPL) seems simple: Split your purchase into instalments, pay later. But behind the scenes, itâ€™s a finely tuned machine ofÂ real-time risk assessment, funding strategies, and monetization models. Letâ€™s break it down.How BNPL Works:1. PurchaseA customer selects BNPL at checkout (e.g., Dhs. 300 purchase).2. Instant Credit DecisioningUnlike traditional credit cards (which rely on hard credit checks), BNPL leveragesÂ alternative data + machine learningÂ for aÂ 1-3 secondÂ approve/decline decision.3. Payment FlowThe first installment is charged immediately (e.g., Dhs. 75). The remaining balance is split into bi-weekly/monthly payments.4. Merchant SettlementBNPL provider pays the merchantÂ upfrontÂ (e.g., Dhs. 291 after a 3% fee) withinÂ 1-7 days.5. Funding the TransactionBalance sheetÂ (rare)Bank partnershipsÂ (overdraft facilities)Hybrid modelsÂ (converting to card instalments)6. Defaults & CollectionsLate payments may incur fees, unpaid balances go to collections.BNPL is no longer just a checkout option, itâ€™s evolving into anÂ embedded finance ecosystem, poweringÂ digital wallets, Super Apps, and in-app marketplaces.With an element of convenience, it is being favored by people to spend more. This has also led to some people getting into debt traps, and getting out of them becomes even more difficult.Although it's a great tool if used responsibly, being alert and managing your finances is essential to reap the benefits of this model.Have you ever tried using the BNPL model?Let's connect CA Kathit Parikh ğŸ’¡ hashtag#Fintech hashtag#BNPL hashtag#Payments hashtag#EmbeddedFinance hashtag#Banking hashtag#CAinDubai hashtag#finance

author: Merushri Baboota
text: You think top schools want a polished resume.They donâ€™t. They want proof youâ€™ve lived the thing youâ€™re applying for.Youâ€™ve done all the â€œrightâ€ things.â†’ The internships â†’ The degree â†’ The 9-to-5 you hateYou even throw in a few extracurriculars to sound more â€œrounded.â€But when you sit down to write your applicationâ€¦It all feels flat.Because none of it sounds likeÂ you.And deep down, you know it.Most people assume top admits go to:- Perfect grades- Big-brand experience- Students with fancy job titlesNope. One of my clients hadÂ noneÂ of that.Finance grad. Internships, yes. Corporate job, yes.But the thing that got him in?Was something he almost left out.He casually mentioned helping his family manage money.Giving friends investment advice.Running the books for a small business.Then said: â€œBut thatâ€™s not relevant, right?â€It wasÂ everything.We built his story around that:1. Real-life, self-driven experience2. Initiative that came before the career3. Proof that heÂ livedÂ finance, not just studied itThatâ€™s what got him the admit.Because admissions teams donâ€™t want your highlight reel.They want to know:A) Do you actually live this work?B) Have youÂ doneÂ the thing even when no one asked you to?Thatâ€™s what we built his application around.Not the titles Not the template.The stuff that actually showed who he was.What he cared about.And why he deserved to be there.PS: If youâ€™re applying with a story that feels â€œsafeâ€ youâ€™re already invisible. DM meÂ â€œSTORYâ€ and Iâ€™ll help you find the part of your story youâ€™ve been told to shrink â†’ And turn it into the reason they say yes. No sugarcoating. Just an application thatÂ hits. Youâ€™ve done the work. Now letâ€™s make it matter.

author: Alpana Razdan
text: This bracelet needs a screwdriver to wear yet it pulled in $1.7 billion last year. (Source: Richemont Group Annual Report, 2023)Thatâ€™s the power of the Cartier Love Bracelet.When Louis-FranÃ§ois Cartier inherited a small workshop in Paris in 1847, his goal wasnâ€™t just to make jewelry. It was to craft symbols fit for royalty.It took 57 years, but by 1904, he was crowned the â€œjeweler of kings and the king of jewelersâ€ by King Edward VII.Since then, Cartier hasnâ€™t just created objects of beauty. It has created meaning.Some of his iconic products areâ€¦ ğŸ“The Trinity Ring â€“ â‚¹1,19,000 - â‚¹46,40,0003 interlocking bands in white, yellow, and rose gold, symbolizing love, friendship, and fidelity.ğŸ“The Santos Watch â€“ â‚¹3,27,000 - â‚¹2,30,00,000 The first modern wristwatch, created for aviator Alberto Santos-Dumont.ğŸ“The Love Bracelet â€“ â‚¹1,63,089 - 5,29,000 (classic yellow gold) Locked with a screwdriverâ€”turning jewelry into a ritual of commitment.This symbolic thinking has built a brand now worth $10.6 billion (Source: Brand Finance Luxury & Premium 50 Report, 2023), with the Love collection alone contributing 30% of its jewelry revenue (Source: Forbes).But Cartierâ€™s magic goes beyond product design: ğŸ“ In-store apps help associates co-create personalized buying experiences. ğŸ“ Their AR â€œLooking Glass Projectâ€ lets customers try on jewelry virtually, factoring in skin tone and lighting, bringing emotional connection to e-commerce. ğŸ“ A headless CMS lets them launch digital campaigns fast while keeping the Cartier feel consistent across every touchpoint (Source: Business of Fashion).ğŸ“  Meanwhile, Cartier is turning luxury into a digital trend, amassing 15M+ Instagram followers (Source: Instagram @cartier) and going viral with reels featuring icons like Jisoo and TimothÃ©e Chalamet.And recent campaigns have only deepened that emotional connection. ğŸ‘‰ In one of the campaigns, actress Elle Fanning sat alone in a cinema. No flashy product shots, just nostalgia and feeling. (Source: Harperâ€™s Bazaar) ğŸ‘‰ In another campaign, global icons like Paul Mescal and Jisoo celebrated 100 years of the Trinity ring, blending heritage with personal identity. (Source: Vogue)Hereâ€™s what other brands can learn from Cartier: â†ªï¸ Lead with emotion, not explanation â†ªï¸ Make your product a symbol â†ªï¸ Mix timeless values with modern relevanceCartier doesnâ€™t just sell luxury.It sells what you want the world to see in you.What brand do you think tells its story best?hashtag#LuxuryBranding hashtag#EmotionalMarketing hashtag#BrandStrategy hashtag#DesignThinking

Etâ€¦ cerise sur le gÃ¢teau, elle est une formidable amie. TrÃ¨s bel et heureux anniversaire ma Karine Ferri ğŸ˜

And the longer you ignore it, the deeper the damage.We need to change what we reward in the workplace.â¡ï¸Stop celebrating all-nightersâ¡ï¸Stop normalizing constant availabilityâ¡ï¸Start talking about rest as a tool for performanceâ€”not a weaknessâ¡ï¸Burnout doesnâ€™t happen overnight.But it shows up when the pressure never lets up, and recovery is never allowed.If youâ€™re a manager, founder, or leader, ask yourself this:Are you building a high-performing team, or just burning through people faster?Itâ€™s time to stop calling exhaustion a goal.hashtag#WorkCulture hashtag#Burnout hashtag#MentalHealth hashtag#IndiaWorkforce

author: Durreen Shahnaz
text: When markets crash, itâ€™s always the poor who feel it first. But this time, some of them are helping hold the system together. How? Through our investment at IIX because we are investing with and for women in the last mile â€“ the â€˜Xâ€™ derisking factor that is still missing in the public markets.A woman running a poultry farm in hashtag#Vietnam.A farmer scaling organic produce in the hashtag#Philippines.A solar cooperative powering villages in hashtag#Indonesia. These are stories of resilient women enterprisesâ€”and of finance done right.Because when impact investments reach the right hands, they can create sustainable returns while other portfolios shake and Wall Street stumbles. So letâ€™s not only ask whatâ€™s wrong with the marketâ€”but who we can invest in to stand strong when markets fail.Itâ€™s time we build a system that sees her. Values her. Invests in her.

author: Vicktoria Klich
text: Since I was 24, I've stood on over 50 stages and been featured in many podcasts and interviews. This made me learn that there are two simple things I've always set as goals for every future talk:â†’ Storytelling: Not just a nice addition, but the essential foundation for making complex ideas accessible â†’ Charm: The often overlooked quality that creates the psychological safety needed for genuine listeningFrom intimate gatherings of 30 people to conferences with 40k+ participants - each environment teaches different lessons about human connection. Small groups offer immediate feedback through facial expressions. Large audiences require creating that same connection but at scale.When explaining Web3 and blockchain technologies to audiences outside our usual circles, I'm often fighting against preconceptions. That's where charm opens the door and storytelling guides people through unfamiliar territory.The stage has been my most valuable classroom - teaching me to put complex technical concepts into clear messages.I never thought I'd be explaining staking to traditional finance professionals or discussing Web3 regulation with government officials. But there I was, bridging worlds.The cherry on top? Seeing someone who entered with skepticism leave with genuine curiosity about blockchain's potential.By the way, I am 28 years old now, so had plenty of time to develop my stage presence. I remember being nervous and doubtful before each talk. This feeling eventually transforms into anticipation and excitement.

author: Mayank Sharma
text: I almost quit MBA in 3 months.Couldnâ€™t deal with the food. The weather. The loneliness.My parents didnâ€™t know. I didnâ€™t tell anyone.I was certain I wouldnâ€™t last.Until someone walks into my life. Having no idea that he is about to change everything for me.IMT Nagpur very well knows this gentlemen. Students love him. I hated Finance but his class was mandatory. Donâ€™t know how or when but I soon found myself venting, crying, figuring life out in his cabin.He didnâ€™t have answers but he was wise enough to figure I didnâ€™t need answers. I just needed support and some guidance to turn it around.Itâ€™s moments like these that changed things for me.Few months later, I was :â‡¾ cracking interviewsâ‡¾ killing stage fearâ‡¾ balancing everythingAll because someone held me at the right time.MBA gave me a degree.But Pawan Sir gave me something far bigger. Strength when I had none.If someone ever showed up for you at your lowestâ€”tag them. Let them know they didnâ€™t just make a difference. They were the difference.Pawan Jain Institute of Management Technology, Nagpurhashtag#careerhashtag#MBAhashtag#imthashtag#mentorhashtag#lifelessons

author: Business Today
text: U.S. Treasury: IMF & World Bank Have Drifted From Core Mission, Are Wasting ResourcesAt a fiery appearance before the Institute of International Finance, U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent issued a no-nonsense call to refocus and reform the Bretton Woods institutions â€” the IMF and World Bank. Backed by the Trump administration, Bessent argued these institutions have drifted from their core missions, wasting resources on â€œsprawling agendasâ€ and â€œbuzzword-centric marketingâ€ instead of tackling real economic challenges. He criticized the IMF for suffering from â€œmission creep,â€ devoting time to issues like climate change and gender, while ignoring macroeconomic imbalances, especially from surplus countries like China. Bessent emphasized that the IMF must return to being a "brutal truth-teller"â€”not afraid to call out flawed policies, unsustainable debt, or currency manipulation. As for the World Bank, Bessent demanded an end to blank checks and called for sharper execution around development goalsâ€”especially energy access, private investment, and debt sustainability. This video dives deep into why the U.S. wants these powerful institutions to stop playing politics and start producing results. Watch: https://lnkd.in/e6nnqrVS | hashtag#IMF hashtag#WorldBank hashtag#ScottBessent hashtag#USPolicy hashtag#GlobalFinance

author: Ganesh Nayak, FRMÂ®, SCRÂ®
text: Do FRM instead of CFA because it is less costly and time consuming.Many students come to me with this statement that doing FRM will be better because of these reasons.But this is absolutely wrong thinking.The question should never be CFA vs FRM. You should never compare these courses.Both the certifications serve different purposes and are not a substitute to any.The reason behind doing FRM should be that you want to make a career in risk profile while that of CFA should be that you want to work in investment analysis related profile. That's it.You are making a big mistake if you are doing a particular certification just because of its cost or time.Both the certifications required significant time and hard work which you can only put if you genuinely want to become the CFA / FRM Charterholder.If you want to seek any clarity or further guidance then feel free to reach out to me.Ready to elevate your CFA | FRM | FP&A | SCR | ESG | CAIA journey? Fintelligents and me are just a tap away ğŸ’¡I help people build a career in Finance. Book a Call now. ğŸ“ (https://lnkd.in/dhX5KC2H)hashtag#frm hashtag#garp hashtag#finance hashtag#cfa

author: Business Today
text: US Treasury Slams Chinaâ€™s Trade Model | Urges Urgent Global RebalancingAt the Institute of International Finance, U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent made a bold statement: China must change â€” now. Responding to President Trump's tariff strategy, Bessent revealed that over 100 countries are aligning with the U.S. to reset the rules of global trade. In a strong rebuke of Chinaâ€™s current economic model, he warned that its reliance on manufacturing and export overcapacity is worsening global imbalances. Bessent stressed that Chinaâ€™s pathâ€”exporting its way out of economic troubleâ€”is not only unsustainable but harmful to the world economy. He called for a shift in China's priorities: away from manufacturing dominance and toward bolstering domestic consumption. Only then, he argued, can real rebalancing happen. But China isnâ€™t the only target. Bessent also criticized the global overdependence on U.S. demand. From excess savings in Asia to wage suppression policies, he pointed out how these practices are undermining global stability. He also cited former ECB President Mario Draghiâ€™s warnings on European stagnation. Watch: https://lnkd.in/ebNv_duT | hashtag#USChinaTrade hashtag#GlobalEconomy hashtag#ScottBessent hashtag#TradeWar hashtag#ChinaEconomy

author: Hani Tohme
text: The next wave of climate innovation isnâ€™t coming; itâ€™s already here, and itâ€™s gaining momentum in the Middle East.With nearly $20 billion earmarked for green initiatives, Saudi Arabiaâ€™s Public Investment Fund (PIF) isnâ€™t just investing in renewable energy or sustainable water management. Itâ€™s part of a broader regional shift that is redefining where climate innovation happens.From issuing the worldâ€™s first 100-year green bond to committing $5.2 billion already toward certified green projects, PIF is demonstrating that sustainability commitments in the region are serious, scalable, and strategic.This mattersâ€¦Because the global sustainability transition wonâ€™t be won in labs alone. It will be won through systems change: finance, infrastructure, and policy all aligned toward a common goal.But that alignment is fragile. The world remains undecided about sustainability. Geopolitics have seeped into environmental agendas, and countries are letting short-term tensions shape long-term priorities.In this uncertain global landscape, GCC countries are choosing a steadier course: one grounded in resilience. By embedding sustainability into economic strategy and long-term planning, the region is not just adapting to change but positioning itself to shape it.And that approach, in my opinion, will pay off.Across the Gulf, the direction is becoming clearer:â€¢ 70% of Saudi Arabiaâ€™s renewable energy target is being developed by PIF.â€¢ Projects span clean transport, land restoration, and resource circularity, aligned with the UN SDGs.â€¢ Regional funds are crafting a blueprint for how emerging economies can lead on climate finance and inclusive growth.Sustainability is not a Western story. Itâ€™s a global one.And the next mega innovation may rise from green bonds, desert ingenuity, and bold regional ambition.hashtag#GreenFinance hashtag#SustainableDevelopment hashtag#PIF hashtag#GCCVision hashtag#ClimateLeadership hashtag#MiddleEastInnovation hashtag#NetZero hashtag#EnergyTransition hashtag#ResilienceEconomyhashtag#CenterForSustainableFutureKearney Kearney Middle East and Africa

author: AIA
text: AIAâ€™s Group Head of Sustainability Amita Chaudhury has been appointed Vice-Chair of the Board of the United Nations Environment Programme Finance Initiative (UNEP FI) Principles for Sustainable Insurance (PSI). With some 300 members around the world, this is the largest initiative between the UN and the global insurance industry. â€œAs a representative of the AIA Group, I look forward to working with the PSI Board to advance sustainable insurance practices globally,â€ said Amita Chaudhury, AIAâ€™s Group Head of Sustainability. The vision of the PSI Initiative is of a risk aware world, where the insurance industry is trusted and plays its full role in enabling a healthy, safe, resilient and sustainable society. The purpose of the PSI Initiative is to better understand, prevent and reduce environmental, social and governance risks, and better manage opportunities to provide quality and reliable risk protection. AIA has been a signatory of the PSI since 2021 and is a committed advocate for sustainability within the insurance industry and beyond. Find out more about AIAâ€™s ESG Strategy in our recently launched ESG Report 2024 at https://lnkd.in/gC-bmjS9hashtag#HealthierLongerBetterLives hashtag#ESG hashtag#Sustainability

author: Brian Sozzi
text: ğŸ“ˆ What the major phone CEOs are saying this week about the impact of tariffs summed up in two words: price increases.ğŸ“ Verizon CEO Hans Vestberg:"In general, if the tariff is going to be as high as they say on the handsets, we are not planning to cover that in our work. That's just not going to be possible. So, we will continue to be financially disciplined in whatever promotions we have, but we will not cover any enormous increase on tariffs on handsets. That's ultimately going to hit the consumer in the market. But again, it's too early to say. We don't know where tariff is going to go."ğŸ“ AT&T CEO John Stankey:"So if tariffs are the next driver of an increase in the unit cost of handsets, I imagine we're going to have to go through the exact same play, which is, first of all, understand what the customer needs and then make some adjustments to how we support them in that process. But that process is going to be taking that cost as we've traditionally done and largely moving it through to the end user and fitting it into the business model of ultimately what we can afford to drive the right level of returns in our business. And I think we've demonstrated over time that we've done that fairly effectively."ğŸ“ T-Mobile CEO Mike Sievert to me on Yahoo Finance (watch below):"Tariffs are unpredictable at this point. Obviously, we're watching closely. If they come in and they're significant in some way, that's going to have to be borne by the customer. I mean, our model isn't prepared for something like that." Added Sievert, "I think what would happen is prices will rise for smartphones and then people will slow down their purchases of smartphones and upgrade rates will slow. Those would be the dynamics that would happen. We don't see that that is on the way."
